definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
abbr. for Sichuan Province 四川[Si4 chuan1] in southwest China

sentences.english: In that day the Lord will snatch away their finery: the bangles and headbands and crescent necklaces
sentences.chinese: 到那日，主必除掉她們華美的腳釧，髮網，月牙圈。

sentences.english: Tom had spent ten minutes on practicing using the radio.
sentences.chinese: Tom花了十分釧練習使用收音機。

sentences.english: Some one was busy with her work， and her bangles made music in the corner.
sentences.chinese: 有人正忙着工作，她的釧鐲在一角放出音樂。

sentences.english: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments about their feet, and their cauls, and their round tires like the moon
sentences.chinese: 到那日，主必除掉他們華美的腳釧，髮網，月牙圈。

sentences.english: The coal cleat pattern in the Kushiro coalfield, Japan, shows some analogy to isolated straight joints.
sentences.chinese: 日本釧路煤田的煤層割理形態類似於孤立的直線節理。

sentences.english: There is no way that you can make body clock for me to knock the hour has passed.
sentences.chinese: 沒有方法能使時釧爲我敲已過去了的鐘點。

definition: operculum (Latin: little lid)/a covering flap (in various branches of anatomy)
to inlay with gold, silver etc/ancient inlaid ornament shaped as a flower
load carried by a pack animal
aromatic herb used for seasoning/variant of 香[xiang1]
